title: Type ID: Whitney Museum Font?
content:
Can anyone help? Is this a custom font?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-06-27 at 7.39.43 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823054700/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-06-27%20at%207.39.43%20PM.png) | 58.27 KB |
author: lucasrpage

comments.content:
Don't know any font like this. It feels custom to me.  
You could start for instance with [PF DIN Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823054700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-din-mono) Medium and customize it by adding mainly some triangle shapes to angles. /W would remain a bit off though.

Found with Google:

The designers specified Neue Haas Grotesk - a redrawn version of a 1950s Swiss typeface - for any text positioned alongside the logo, while any images can be positioned underneath.
That is not Neue Haas Grotesk
Sorry, when I commented the image was not available and I interpreted the question literally…
